vectors.text: Utilitarianism evaluates actions based on their consequences for overall happiness
Deontological ethics judges morality based on adherence to rules and duties
Virtue ethics focuses on developing good character traits for moral excellence
Dualism posits that mind and body are fundamentally different substances
Determinism holds that all events are caused by prior events according to laws
Existentialism emphasizes individual freedom and authentic self-creation
Empiricism claims all knowledge derives from sensory experience
Rationalism holds that reason is the primary source of knowledge
Skepticism questions whether certain knowledge is possible
Social contract theory derives political legitimacy from agreement among citizens
Moral relativism holds that ethical truths vary across cultures
Idealism claims that reality is fundamentally mental or spiritual
Materialism reduces all phenomena to physical matter and its interactions
Pragmatism evaluates truth based on practical consequences and usefulness
Foundationalism builds knowledge on basic self-evident beliefs
Care ethics emphasizes relationships and responsibility to others
Phenomenology studies consciousness and subjective experience
Coherentism justifies beliefs through mutual support within a belief system
The trolley problem explores moral intuitions about action versus inaction
Free will debates whether human choices are truly autonomous
